msItem.title: Fragments of the Psalms, according to the Peshitta version, arranged as the first part of a Choirbook
msItem.rubric: ܒܐܘܣ̣ܝܐ: ܕܐܒܐ ܘܕܒܪܐ ܘܕܪܘܚܐ ܩ̇ܕܝܫܐ: ܡ̇ܫܪܝܢܢ ܕܢ̇ܟܬܘܒ ܥܠ ܚ̇ܝ̣ܠܐ ܘܣ̣ܘܝܥܐ ܕܠܝܬܝܘܬܐ ܘܫ̇ܘܼܝܬ (sic) ܬܫ̈ܒܚܬܐ ܕܕܘܝܕ ܡ̇ܠ̣ܟܐ ܘܢ̇ܒܝܐ: ܟܬܦܐ ܩ̇ܕܡܝܬܐ .

msItem.title: Psalms i.1-xxi.7
Psalms lxxiv.3—lxxxvi.10
Psalms lxxxviii.13—lxxxix.19
Psalms xcviii.7—ci.8

item.p: Twenty vellum leaves, about 6 1/8 in. by 4 7/8, several of which are much stained and torn. The quires are signed with letters. There are from 12 to 17 lines in each page.

handNote.desc: The writing is of about the xiith cent.

msItem.title: A fragment of the first part (ܐ) of a Choir-book, containing Psalms ii. 6—x. 15, according to the Peshitta version
msItem.note: The verso of the last leaf seems to have been left blank by the scribe

item.p: Four vellum leaves, all much soiled and torn. There are 17 or 18 lines in each page.

handNote.desc: The writing is partly cursive, partly Estrangela, of the xiith or xiiith cent.

msItem.title: Hosea, ch. x. 14 — xi. 8, according to the Peshitta version.

item.p: A single vellum leaf slightly torn.

layout.p: There are 19 lines on each page.

item.p: Some Greek vowels have been added by a later hand.

msItem.title: Flyleaf for a volume, of discourses ofJacob of Batnae.
msItem.note: Fol. 52 has been used as a flyleaf for a volume, of discourses ofJacob of Batnae, as appears from the list of contents on the margin:

note.quote: ܡܐܡܪ̈ܐ ܥܠ ܣܘܠܩܐ. ܘܥܠ ܒܬܘܠܘܬܐ. ܘܥܠ ܡܪܬܝܢܘܬܐ. ܘܥܠ ܒܪܐ ܕܦ̇ܪܚ ܢܟܣ̈ܘܗܝ. ܘܥܠ ܡܓܕܦܢܐ. ܘܥܠ ܪ̈ܐܙܐ ܩܕܝ̈ܫܐ. ܘܥܠ ܐܒܘܢ ܕܒܫܡܝܐ. ܘܥܠ ܪܚ̇ܡܥܠܝ ܐܝܟ ܛܝܒܘܬܟ. ܘܥܠ ܝܘܣܦ.

recordHist.source: Manuscript description based on Wright's Catalogue . abbreviated by the Syriaca.org editors.

bibl.author: William Wright
bibl.title: Catalogue of Syriac Manuscripts in the British Museum Acquired since the Year 1838

msItem.title: The Epistle to the Hebrews, ch. xii. 28 to the end, according to the Peshitta version.
msItem.note: It is the last leaf of a Nestorian manuscript of the New Testament, datedA.Gr. 993,A.H. 63,A.D. 682.

handNote.desc: The writing is a small, neat Estrangela.

item.p: The colophon, which is unfortunately much mutilated, runs as follows:

p.quote: ܐܫܬܠܡ ܕܝܢ ܟܬܒܐ ܗܢܐ ܕܚܕܬܐ ܒܫܢܬ ܬܫܥܡܐܐ ܘܬܫܥܝܢ ܘܬܠܬ ܒܕܝܘ̈ܢܝܐ ܕܐܝܬܝܗ ܒܕܡܗܓܪ̈ܝܐ ܒ̈ܢܝ ܐܝܫـ[ܡܥܐܝܠ] ܒܪ ܗܓܪ ܒܪ ܐܒܪܗܡ ܫܢܬ ܫܬܝܢ ܘܬܠܬ ܒ . . . ܕܪܥܝܐ ܥܝܪܐ ܘܚܦܝܛܐ ܡܕ . . . ܡܫܝܚܐ ܡܪܝ ܓܝܘܪܓܝܣ . . . ܒܐܣܟܘܠܐ ܕܕܝܪܐ ܩܕܝܫܐ . . . ܢܨܝܚܐ ܕܨܠܘܬܗ ܬܥܕܪ ܠܢ ܐܒܐ.......ܡܛܪܦܘܠܝܛܣ ܕܥܕܬܐ ܩܕܝܫܐܬ.......ܡܪܝ ܩܪܚܐ (؟) ܩܫܝܫܐ ܘܪܝܫܕܝܪܐ . . . ܡܩܪܝܢܐ ܕܝܠܗ̇ ܕܐܣܟܘܠܐ . . . ܕܐ . . . ܘܘ ܒܗ̇ ܒܐܣـ[ܟܘܠܐ] . . . ܐ . . ܐ ܫ̈ܡܗܐ ܐ . . . ܐܦܪܝ ܘܓܘܫܢܘܝ ܘܝܫ . . .ܘܩܛܝܢܝ . ܘܓܝܘܪܓܝ . . . ܘܕܫܪܟܐ ܕܐܚܘܬܐ . . . ܟܝܢܐ ܕܟܣܸܐ ܡـ . . .

recordHist.source: Manuscript description based on Wright's Catalogue . abbreviated by the Syriaca.org editors.

msItem.author: Ephraim
msItem.title: The Testament of Ephraim
msItem.note: See Assemani, Bibl. Or., t. i., p. 141, no. 8, and Overbeck, S. Ephraemi Syri etc. Opera Selecta, pp. xvii. and 137

msItem.author: Isaac of Antioch
msItem.title: A metrical discourse of Isaac of Antioch on the plague in the days of King David (2 Sam., ch. xxiv)
msItem.rubric: ܡܐܡܪܐ ܕܥܠ ܡܘܬܢܐ ܕܗܘܐ ܒܝ̈ܘܡܝ ܕܘܝܕ ܢܒܝܐ. ܕܣܝܡ ܠܛܘܒܢܐ ܡܪܝ ܐܝܣܚܩ ܐܦܝܣܩܘܦܐ ܘܡܠܦܢܐ.
msItem.incipit: ܕܘܝܕ ܡܠܟܐ ܒܪ ܐܝܫܝ ܐܬܚ̇ܫܒ ܗܘܐ ܟܣܝܐܝܬ: ܘܪܗ̣ܛ ܫ̇ܡܫ ܓܠܝܐܝܬ. ܡܕܡ ܕܪܢ̣ܐ ܪܥܝܢܗ: ܏ܘܫ.
msItem.note: For the rest of this discourse see Add. 14,608 (no. DCCLXVI), to which manuscript these leaves belong.

item.p: Eight vellum leaves, about 8 7/8 in. by 5 7/8, some of which are slightly stained and torn (Add. 14,666, foll. 57—64). There are from 24 to 26 lines in each page.

handNote.desc: The writing is a large, regular Estrangela of the viith or viiith cent.

recordHist.source: Manuscript description based on Wright's Catalogue , abbreviated by the Syriaca.org editors.

bibl.author: William Wright
bibl.title: Catalogue of Syriac Manuscripts in the British Museum Acquired since the Year 1838

interpretation.p: Description is based on Wright's Catalogue without consultation of physical manuscripts. Foliation is approximate. Wright often does not indicate ending folia so those have been assumed based on beginning folia.
Scribal notes which could not be more clearly classified based on Wright's descriptions have been identified as <addition>s whether they occur in the margins or the body of the manuscript.
In general, we have classified as an <msItem> as much of the manuscript contents as possible, including tables of contents and indices.

category.category: Catenae Patrum and Demonstrations against Heresies
Councils of the Church and Ecclesioastical Canons

langUsage.language: Unvocalized Syriac of any variety or period
Arabic Garshuni in Vocalized West Syriac Script
Arabic Garshuni in Vocalized East Syriac Script
